alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Dixon (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 02 at 4:22AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...VERY HIGH TO NEAR CRITICAL FIRE DANGER EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON... Well above average to near record temperatures, low humidity, and strong southerly winds combine for very high to near critical fire danger this afternoon and evening. The worst conditions are expected between noon and 7 pm today. The strongest winds are expected east of the James River with up to 45 mph gusts possible. The lowest humidity remains in south central SD, with values near 25 percent. People are urged to exercise extreme care with respect to outdoor activities that could cause grass or crop fires. Use extra caution with equipment that can cause sparks near dry grass or vegetation. Do not toss cigarettes on the ground. Report new fires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
